Articles.Content:
On 1/17/2016 at 3:30 PM, Nhawks17 said:

1.0.0: (dependent on stable(ish) version of Scatterer and EVE available)

  • Textures finalized
  • Configuration files finalized

1.1.0:

  • Jool rings redone
  • Additional features such as dust storms and snow storms added

1.2.0: 

  • RSS colored version released (based on RVE development)
  • CityLight map redone

1.3.0:

  • Textures change to grayscale (for the most part) and colors are transitioned to EVE config control

Just a couple comments here... things that kind of stuck out. My two cents, nothing more.

I think you may have the ideas for 1.3 and 1.1/1.2 backwards. If you do things in that order, does it not make even more work for you when you convert the textures to greyscale? More things will have textures, which means more conversion, more tweaking in EVE, etc, than if you did that first (after 1.0, of course) and then only had to tweak the new ones to match, right? I could, of course, be way off, but if you know you are going to do the work anyhow, why not get it out of the way and done... perhaps while waiting for the stable versions of Scatterer and EVE anyhow?

Still looks good, still lovin' the pretties - just hoping to maybe save you some extra work later down the pipeline.

16 hours ago, Shadriss said:

Just a couple comments here... things that kind of stuck out. My two cents, nothing more.

I think you may have the ideas for 1.3 and 1.1/1.2 backwards. If you do things in that order, does it not make even more work for you when you convert the textures to greyscale? More things will have textures, which means more conversion, more tweaking in EVE, etc, than if you did that first (after 1.0, of course) and then only had to tweak the new ones to match, right? I could, of course, be way off, but if you know you are going to do the work anyhow, why not get it out of the way and done... perhaps while waiting for the stable versions of Scatterer and EVE anyhow?

Still looks good, still lovin' the pretties - just hoping to maybe save you some extra work later down the pipeline.

With the 1.2.0 version depending on the development of RVE (the work pingopete is doing for RSS which this mod is based on) it won't be difficult for me to push out that version because as soon as it's made available there in the RSS colors, I'll be able to do simple file name changes and have it work immediately (it'd be like a max of 10 minutes at most when I have the textures available from him). Now, if for whatever reason the development of RVE takes longer than I'm expecting (pingopete is coming back to work on it in a week though so I don't see why it would) I'd probably go ahead and overhaul the textures thus changing the roadmap.

With the 1.2.0 version depending on the development of RVE (the work pingopete is doing for RSS which this mod is based on) it won't be difficult for me to push out that version because as soon as it's made available there in the RSS colors, I'll be able to do simple file name changes and have it work immediately (it'd be like a max of 10 minutes at most when I have the textures available from him). Now, if for whatever reason the development of RVE takes longer than I'm expecting (pingopete is coming back to work on it in a week though so I don't see why it would) I'd probably go ahead and overhaul the textures thus changing the roadmap.

whenever you decide to change to white textures, I will be very happy

except for Auroras, those can stay colored with "color = 1,1,1,1" in the cfg

1 hour ago, Sigma88 said:

whenever you decide to change to white textures, I will be very happy

except for Auroras, those can stay colored with "color = 1,1,1,1" in the cfg

Oh I know you will be  Yeah, I've seen in other packs that aurora's always stay colored in-texture. Do you mean 255,255,255,255 though? Its on the 0-255 scale now, not 0-1 like it used to be.

14 minutes ago, Nhawks17 said:

Oh I know you will be  Yeah, I've seen in other packs that aurora's always stay colored in-texture. Do you mean 255,255,255,255 though? Its on the 0-255 scale now, not 0-1 like it used to be.

Yeah sorry got confused.

Hello
Nhawks17 what Eve version do you use coz from how you was sen in Pingo post i am try to revert your config to RSS needs what goo very good if i use EVE from your pack BUT if i try to use last zip release from Rbray https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/blob/master/x86-EVE-Release.zip evrething is start stop working noo more cloud, noo more nothing ... i gues Rbray was change something in his last version what not make your config file compatible to

As an FYI - This no longer appears on CKAN at all. Prob'ly intentional, thought I'd mention it anyway.

Second - how large of a memory footprint does this really add? I've noticed a significant number of memory related crashes since I started using this (MR version) that didn't use to be there, and I don't really run too much in the way of parts mods (Only KW, a pair of ballast tank mods, and DMagic) and a scattering of mods that add functionality (MechJeb, etc). I've had graphic overhauls like this in the past and not seen this, so I have to wonder how well optimized the textures are for the game.

1 hour ago, Shadriss said:

As an FYI - This no longer appears on CKAN at all. Prob'ly intentional, thought I'd mention it anyway.

Second - how large of a memory footprint does this really add? I've noticed a significant number of memory related crashes since I started using this (MR version) that didn't use to be there, and I don't really run too much in the way of parts mods (Only KW, a pair of ballast tank mods, and DMagic) and a scattering of mods that add functionality (MechJeb, etc). I've had graphic overhauls like this in the past and not seen this, so I have to wonder how well optimized the textures are for the game.

Well all textures that can be are in the .dds format so they're as optimized as they're going to get. However, I don't know the exact amount of extra memory it adds as it's different for every person and depends on which graphics api you are using. I plan on doing benchmarks before the release version and have that information available to people who need it but I haven't had it add more than 2GB of RAM and that's on the UR version. As to the CKAN thing, I don't know what's going on with that. I've recently found out how to write the netkan files for CKAN so I'll be able to release official support for it once this is released as it is just doing whatever is done when you use Kerbal Stuff.

SVERSS, a port of SVE, a port of RVE

On 14/01/2016 at 8:13 PM, Nhawks17 said:

Interesting. Unfortunately I'm not able to test anything on Linux so I have to rely on feedback. There is a dev forum but it's not very active so I'd check the main EVE thread if you haven't already. If you have, go ahead and post something to rbray so he knows it's happening with his latest dev version, he'll be able to look into way better than I'd be able to. Sorry about that

In case you are interested, I figured out what was breaking EVEManager.  Installing Kerbal Plus Remade by KillAshley  causes the version of EVE included with SVE to break.

Just thought you might want to know. I'll  post the error in that thread also.

15 minutes ago, armegeddon said:

In case you are interested, I figured out what was breaking EVEManager.  Installing Kerbal Plus Remade by KillAshley  causes the version of EVE included with SVE to break.

Just thought you might want to know. I'll  post the error in that thread also.

Interesting... Did an earlier/later version of EVE fix the issue or are you still getting it.

2 hours ago, Nhawks17 said:

Interesting... Did an earlier/later version of EVE fix the issue or are you still getting it.

Kplus reloaded works fine with the version of eve from CKAN. It's only with the version included with SVE that things break. I didn't try any other versions since I normally try not to use dev versions of mods unless they make significant improvements and fixes over release versions (etc mechjeb).

7 minutes ago, armegeddon said:

Kplus reloaded works fine with the version of eve from CKAN. It's only with the version included with SVE that things break. I didn't try any other versions since I normally try not to use dev versions of mods unless they make significant improvements and fixes over release versions (etc mechjeb).

Gotcha. Well hopefully rbray will get back to working on EVE soon so I can continue working on this!
is this mod compatible with KSP 64k? It look very nice and I would like to use it on my 64k save

3 hours ago, Joco223 said:

is this mod compatible with KSP 64k? It look very nice and I would like to use it on my 64k save

I think with a few tweaks it is

Hi hawks,

Thank you for a glorious mod!

I really hope i haven't missed anything in this thread, but i have this problem here:

I run Ubuntu 14.04 LTS with the latest Nvidia drivers and SVE Ultra settings. I've done a clean modded install, an install with only SVE and still the same problem.

Hope I’m not the only one.

I appreciate any and all help i can get, thanks in advance.

1 minute ago, superm18 said:

Hi hawks,

Thank you for a glorious mod!

I really hope i haven't missed anything in this thread, but i have this problem here:

I run Ubuntu 14.04 LTS with the latest Nvidia drivers and SVE Ultra settings. I've done a clean modded install, an install with only SVE and still the same problem.

Hope I’m not the only one.

I appreciate any and all help i can get, thanks in advance.

Hi! You are actually not the only one. However, this bug is caused from Scatterer in OpenGL (I think its because of OpenGL). Blackrack knows about it and he said he is working on finding out what causes this for some people. Unless it goes away on it's own the only way I can see you getting rid of the issue is by disabling the Scatterer oceans and reverting back to stock oceans

No way am I going back to stock ocean! This whole mod makes KSP feel real.

I've noticed, it comes and goes with scene change, so I don't mind it all that much. Glad to hear your on top of it, thanks.
